website_summaries.verdict: A unique power steering fluid that not only works on blockages, but helps to maintain the system for a longer life.
pros: Uses a specific formula that works to preserve and protect the power steering system
Can also be used on other engine and drivetrain components such as the pumps, seals, and cylinders
cons: Doesn’t last as long as other steering fluids available at budget prices

customer_reviews.title: Mostly fixed loud pump on Ford Taurus
customer_reviews.text: Although the steering pump and fluid is 1 year old on my 2004 Taurus, it started whining recently. Using a turkey baster, I removed about 10oz of the fluid and replaced with this product. In two days I realized that the whining is quiet. Not vanished, but I can only hear it if I really pay close attention to it. Seems to be working.
customer_reviews.author: Andrei

customer_reviews.title: Worked on my Honda/Acura
customer_reviews.text: It smoothed out the steering and it no longer whines. I only use Honda fluids for power steering, however Lucas DOES work in Honda's and in my case quieted the pump down. Eventually I will need to replace the pump or rebuild it with new seals. In some case, the O-ring on the power steering line just needs replaced.
customer_reviews.author: B Merry

customer_reviews.title: A must in an old car
customer_reviews.text: Lucas conditioners have kept our 1997 Corolla going for YEARS. My dad has been a mechanic for 40 years and recommended it to me when the car started leaking oil and it had helped immensely. Our mechanic agrees that he's seen it work some miracles. This is for our power steering - we've had a leak for a long time, and we'll notice that it gets worse if we don't use the conditioner regularly. We can refill it with power steering fluid, but we have to use the lucas conditioner regularly to keep it from leaving too badly.
